entry.title: Rise into the Future with Agentic AI in Enterprise Asset Management
entry.content:
In 2025, "Agentic AI" has emerged as a transformative force in the world of Business. But what exactly does this buzzword mean for businesses striving to optimize their asset maintenance and operational efficiency?

The upcoming, "Rise into the Future: Expert Demo Session – SAP AI Agents in Action" hosted by SAP, offers a compelling glimpse into how agentic AI is revolutionizing asset management within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will explore the practical benefits and innovations that agentic AI brings to the table for enterprises looking to streamline their maintenance processes.

What is Agentic AI?

Agentic AI refers to intelligent AI agents that act autonomously within a business context to solve complex problems and execute tasks with minimal human intervention. Unlike traditional AI, which often requires manual inputs and oversight, agentic AI understands the broader business environment and can make decisions that align with organizational goals. This capability is especially powerful in asset management, where coordination between production schedules, resources, and maintenance plans is critical.

Transforming Enterprise Asset Maintenance

The integration of agentic AI into SAP’s cloud ERP system is designed to bring clarity, speed, and control to enterprise asset maintenance. Here’s how:

  • Alignment of Production and Maintenance: AI agents dynamically synchronize production schedules with maintenance activities, ensuring that asset upkeep does not disrupt operations. This alignment reduces downtime and maximizes asset availability.
  • Resource Optimization: By understanding resource availability and constraints, AI agents allocate maintenance tasks efficiently, preventing bottlenecks and overuse of personnel or equipment.
  • Simplified Task Management: The AI copilot feature breaks down complex maintenance tasks into clear, actionable steps. This simplification empowers maintenance teams to execute their work more effectively and with greater confidence.

To Learn More

The "Rise into the Future: Expert Demo Session" by SAP is your opportunity to see agentic AI in action. Experts will demonstrate how these AI agents work seamlessly within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition to transform enterprise asset management. Attendees will gain insights into how AI-driven workflows can help their organizations achieve operational excellence and maintain a competitive edge.

entry.title: SAP Asset Performance Management - Manage Embedded IoT Metadata Sync
entry.content:
In this blog, I would like to outline how to read the connectivity status for a set of technical objects in SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) - Embedded IoT.

Post the successful integration of  S/4HANA system with SAP APM, all the technical objects in SAP Asset Performance Management, with one or more indicators, are automatically synchronized to Embedded IoT platform to enable time series data ingestion. If we need to know the synchronization status of one or more technical objects including indicators, we can use READ Public APIs. Also, we can use POST Public API to manually retrigger a sync to the underlying IoT platform for a specific technical object if needed before the automatic scheduler run.

If you want to gain deep understanding of certain key functionalities in SAP Asset Performance Management (APM), i.e. Failure Curve Analytics and Achieving Sustainability with SAP APM through Industrial Systems, check out my previous posts below.

  1. Configuring Failure Curve Analytics (FCA) In SAP APM 
  2. Achieving Sustainability With SAP APM By Leveraging Industrial Systems 
  3. What`s New in SAP APM release 2502 

My Business Use Case: My Calcination plant has an Air Compressor(NL HZ) equipped with six key Indicators. I have created the equipment master in S4HANA system and replicated it to SAP APM. Now, I will use READ Public API to know the status of synchronization to the underlying IoT platform. Also, I will use POST Public API to manually re-trigger a sync to the EIoT platform for a "Submersible Pump-03 1.5HP 12 Stages".

First things first, ensure that the data replication toggle bar is turned ON in SAP APM.

Now, let us take a look at the Air Compressor and its Indicator data in SAP APM.

Air Compressor Indicators

I have set up the environment to use READ and POST public APIs for Technical Object & Indicator. SAP Has provided "Try Out" option for certain APIs to retrieve data from our own SAP APM system.

let us add the basic information to have the environment, e.g., Client ID, Host URL, Domain & Sub-Domain, etc.

 

 

Following the successful environment set-up, let us check Equipment 10001729 status.

 

 

Now, let us look at the technical objects and their indicators status. The value of $expand is only supported for indicators.

 

 

 

 

Now, let us take a look at the status of the Indicators.

 

 

 

POST Public API:

Fact Sheet: The following situations demand the usage of POST public API to manually re-trigger the sync to the EIoT platform.

  • When the automatic synchronization fails.
  • When we want to immediately sync a technical object to the underlying EIoT platform and not wait for the automatic scheduler to run, which runs once every 30 minutes.

Now, let me walk you through the POST public API to manually re-trigger the equipment "Submersible Pump-03, 1.5HP, 12 Stage" sync to the EIoT platform.

First let us create an Equipment in S4HANA system and sync it manually to the SAP APM system using "integration monitor".

 

 

Fact Sheet:

The master data, i.e., Equipment, Functional Location, Class, Characteristics, etc., synchronization between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) occurs once in 2 Hours.

For Instance, I have manually triggered the equipment data sync to the SAP APM using Integration Monitor App.

 

Following the successful synchronization, system displays the equipment 10001778 in SAP APM.

Although Equipment 10001778 has been synced to the SAP APM, the indicator has not yet been onboarded to the underlying EIoT platform. When I attempted to add a new measurement reading  in SAP APM manually to the Indicator, system displayed the following error message. System takes 30 minutes to onboard the indicator to the underlying EIoT platform.

Now, let us manually re-trigger the Indicator sync to the EIoT platform using POST Public  API.

 

Once we run the POST Public API, system initiates the synchronization to the EIoT platform and prompts us to use  the GET public API to know the connectivity status.

Now, let us use GET Public API to know the connectivity status. To get the Indicator details, we must use the value of "$expand" for indicators.

 

 

Now , the system has synchronized the indicator successfully to the underlying EIoT platform, and enables to add indicator value.

 

 

😊This is all about understanding the synchronization status of one or many technical objects and their indicators using READ, POST public APIs. I hope my blog proves useful to my beloved maintenance team.

Sincerely,

entry.title: SAP Asset Performance Management - Visual Asset Health Monitoring (Part-1)
entry.content:
Visual Health Monitoring is a powerful tool that uses vision to assess the asset condition and identify the potential problems. As part of the SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) June 2025 release, SAP introduced Manage Visual Inspection Results application for reviewing, verifying, and approving visual inspection results.

In this blog, I will outline how an asset`s condition can be documented with an image using a visual health monitoring application. In this demonstration, I will use SAP standard API to upload the image to the equipment indicator.

My Business Use Case: My organization uses Non Lubricated, Horizontal Air Compressor to produce plant air. When I was working as a mechanical engineer, I conducted daily rounds to visually inspect equipment in my section, recorded key operational parameters, and took corrective actions whenever deviations observed. 

Now, let us assume that we have visual health monitoring application to record operational parameters. For Instance , I go for a daily round to visually inspect the air compressor, and record the suction filter condition with an image and allow maintenance manager confirm the recorded condition. In this process, for demonstration purpose, I will use POSTMAN tool to upload the image and measurement reading.

If you want to gain deep understanding of certain key functionalities in SAP Asset Performance Management (APM), i.e. Failure Curve Analytics, Achieving Sustainability with SAP APM through Industrial Systems, and Embedded IoT Metadata Synchronization, check out my previous posts below.

  1. Configuring Failure Curve Analytics (FCA) In SAP APM 
  2. Achieving Sustainability With SAP APM By Leveraging Industrial Systems 
  3. What`s New in SAP APM release 2502 
  4. SAP Asset Performance Management - Manage Embedded IoT Metadata Sync 

Let us dive in and explore...

Visual Asset Health Monitoring is effective for:

Early Detection Of Defects: This helps identify the potential failures and prevents unexpected functional failures.

Automated Inspections with AI: Integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) into inspection process can efficiently identify the anomalies.

Cost Savings: Early detection of potential failures can lead to substantial savings in maintenance expenses.

Regulatory Compliance: This helps comply to the regulatory body requirements if any.

Customer Satisfaction: This streamlines maintenance activities and ensures that assets remain functional and safe to operate, thus enhances maintenance team efficiency.

Operational Efficiency: By identifying the defects in advance using image analysis, maintenance can minimize the disruptions and thus improves efficiency.

Risk Management: Leveraging image analysis, maintenance team can execute more effective risk assessments on technical objects.

Prerequisites and Limitations: Please find the link below to know more about prerequisites and limitations for visual asset health monitoring Apps/APIs.

Prerequisites and Limitations for Visual Asset Health Monitoring Apps/APIs

Air Compressor Indicators in SAP APM

Categorizing the indicator for Visual Inspection

 

The master data setup has been completed. Now let us post Inspection results to the indicator. This involves uploading the image and associated data (such as, dot annotation coordinates). The Dot Annotation Coordinates are crucial in guiding the system on where the AI should focus its analysis within the image. The Dot Annotation`s position is determined by coordinates sent in the payload.

Get the "Manage Visual Inspection Results  - POST API" from API hub.

Manage Visual Inspection Results -POST API

Download the "OpenAPI JSON" file for "Manage Visual Inspection Results" from the API hub. Then use the "Import" feature in the POSTMAN tool to set up the collection request.

Following the successful collection request setup, input the parameters for the indicator. To get the indicator position ID and Characteristic Id for the AI Indicator, call the  READ API : Metadata Sync-Technical Objects. 

For instance, I have updated the suction filter obstruction to 49.44% and uploaded the following image.

 

 

Once the data for the AI indicator is set, upload the Image of the suction filter and POST the corresponding values.

 

Now, let us navigate to "Manage Visual Inspection Results App." in SAP APM  to validate and approve  visual inspection results, updating the status to "Confirmed".

 

 

 

Now the status has become "Confirmed". The "Confirmed" status indicates that user has validated and approved the inspection results.

Now, let us check the annotation details of the uploaded Image to ensure accuracy.

entry.title: What's New SAP Asset Performance Management 2506
entry.content:
Welcome to the 2506 release of SAP Asset Performance Management (APM). 

This release brings two major innovations: native APM Transport Management powered by SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS), and the ability to seamlessly consume device data ingested via the Embedded IoT platform. 

You’ll also find smarter filtering options, clearer visibility into file uploads, and new OData APIs built on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) to support maintenance recommendations based on risk, criticality, functions, and failure modes.

And as a quick heads up we'd love you to join our new Customer Engagement Initiative Empowering Reliability: Data-Driven Maintenance Efficiency Analysis for Strategy Optimization. Collaborate with us and help us gather specific user needs and validate initial ideas for analytical tools, visualizations, and workflows that will form the foundation of a future solution! Register by July 26, 2025.

Let's take a look at release 2506.

Introducing APM Transport Management with SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS)

SAP Asset Performance Management now offers its own native transport management solution using the SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS), replacing previous manual processes. This centralized service lets you efficiently move configurations and templates across your connected cloud environments.

You can access the CTMS via a new app called Transport Management.

Each system environment is represented as a node in CTMS, providing clear visibility and control over your transport landscape. Secure connections called destinations link CTMS to each tenant, while defined transport routes manage the flow of configurations to ensure data moves securely and in the correct order.

This new solution supports transporting key objects including:

  • Communication system configurations
  • Coding masks
  • Risk and criticality assessment templates
  • Strategy assessment templates for classes, including associated recommendations

To ensure smooth transports, all related SAP S/4HANA master data and dependencies should be synchronized and available in the target tenant before initiating transport.

For more information, see the SAP Help portal at:

  • Transport Management
  • Transport Communication Systems
  • Transport Coding Masks
  • Transport Strategy Assessment Templates
  • Transport Assessment Templates
  • Integration with SAP Cloud Transport Management service.

Watch this video to see it in action:

Smarter Filtering in APM: Failure Data Profile & Risk Score Type

Customers working with technical objects often face challenges when filtering equipment or understanding risk scores. We’ve introduced two key enhancements to improve usability and decision-making:

1. Failure Data Profile in Explore Technical Objects app

Within the Explore Technical Objects app, users can now filter more effectively using the Failure Data Profile:

  • Fuzzy search helps find matching failure patterns quickly.
  • A new column supports condition-based filtering.
  • Related technical objects are displayed instantly, making it easier to act on recurring issues.

2. Risk Score Type Filtering

Previously, risk scores were stored in mixed formats—numeric and alphanumeric—leading to sorting issues.

What’s new:
  • Users can now filter by risk score type for better clarity.
  • Sorting by ascending or descending scores works accurately.
  • Equipment without RC scores is also flagged, helping highlight missing data.

These enhancements make it easier to identify critical technical objects and understand their risk levels—supporting more effective reliability planning.

Embedded IoT - Availability of Device Connectivity Data

Ingest Data via Embedded IoT Platform provider and Consume it Seamlessly in APM

We've got great news for those working with connected assets: it's now possible to consume data in Asset Performance Management (APM) that was ingested via our Embedded IoT Platform provider.

This enhancement brings flexibility to customers using protocols like MQTT to send times series data for their assets. By leveraging embedded IoT capabilities, you can now use the data that is ingested via device protocols into the Embedded IoT provider platform in APM to support asset health monitoring, predictive maintenance, and intelligent decision-making. 

Why This Matters

Many industrial environments use lightweight messaging protocols like MQTT to collect telemetry data from machines, devices, and sensors. Embedded IoT makes it easy to ingest and process this data. Until now, this data was not yet made available for consumption in APM.

With this new capability, you can:

  • Ingest telemetry data via our embedded iot provider (e.g., using MQTT)
  • Benefit from automated data integration into APM without manual steps or interventions
  • Use APM features to monitor asset condition, define failure thresholds, and generate maintenance requests

Device connectivity data from the embedded IoT provider platform is now available in SAP Asset Performance Management for consumption as a part of the SAP Early Adopter Care Program. For more information, see Device Data Integration in SAP Asset Performance Management   To obtain access to this feature, refer to Getting Early Adopter Access to New Features and Functions.

This brief video shows how to map sensor time series to asset indicators using the Digital Twin Manager in SAP Asset Performance Management.

File Upload Status in the Integration Monitor

For customers using the Data Integration channel via File Uploads on Embedded IoT, the Integration Monitor offers a new File Upload Status page, enhancing transparency for the file upload feature introduced last year.

Together, these features provide tools to customize, visualize, secure, connect, and optimize your assets, turning complex data into clear insights and confident actions—so your assets perform at their best. 

New OData APIs as part of the CAP transition

As part of the transition to the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), we’ve introduced new OData APIs to support more flexible and future-ready integrations. These APIs are designed to help determine maintenance recommendations based on risk, criticality, functions, and failure modes. See https://api.sap.com/api/recommendationOdata/overview

 

Stay Informed and Get Involved

  • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
  • Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.
  • Collaborate with us! Don't forget to register by July 26, 2025 for our new Customer Engagement Initiative Empowering Reliability: Data-Driven Maintenance Efficiency Analysis for Strategy Optimization. We'd love to have you on board! 

See you in the next release!

entry.title: SAP Asset Performance Management - Ingesting Time Series Data - Derivation & Monitor Rule Management
entry.content:
This blog outlines the steps involved in ingesting time series data using the File Upload API method into SAP Asset Performance Management(APM) and processing the time series data using  Rule Management - Derivation and Monitor Rules.

The time series data plays a crucial role in estimating asset health and risk. For condition-based maintenance of assets, SAP APM application reads the time series data from IoT. There are various methods to ingest time series data into SAP APM, including:

  • Manual Insertion of Indicator Values in SAP APM
  • SAP S/4HANA Measurement Documents
  • File Upload API
  • Measurements API

For processing time series data with rules, SAP APM supports the rule types listed below:

  • Monitoring Rule: A rule which operates on a designated schedule.
  • Derivation Rule: A rule which takes data from a technical object and uses formula to calculate a new value for another indicator of the same technical object.
  • Aggregation Rule: A rule which allows to use one indicator which is common across all subordinate technical objects, and aggregate it up to an indicator of the parent technical object.

Ingest Time Series Data using File Upload API:

The following public APIs  are available for ingesting time series data.

  • File Upload(POST API): It enables maintenance team to create time series data from a source file (.parquet format). This API creates IoT time series data for a combination of technicalObjectNumber, technicalObjectType, SSID, positionID, and categoryName wwithin a particular time range.
  • File Status(READ API): It enables maintenance team to retrieve the status (received, scanned, processed) of the uploaded file using the file ID. 

Mini Note: As part of the June 2025 release, SAP APM has introduced a new IoT data integration feature in the Integration Monitor application to track the real-time processing status of uploaded files through clear progress updates and status indicators. In this blog, I will focus on the new IoT data integration feature instead of  FILE Status (READ API).

entry.title: BILL OF MATERIALS (BOM)
entry.content:
BOM: - 

BOM -> Bill Of materials is a function which is widely used across many modules in sap. Modules namely Production planning (PP) will use mainly material Bom to get the finished product , Sales and distribution (SD) will also use material Bom but they will use the material Bom is and only if they are selling a component which is having multiple sub components for example computer and when it comes to Plant Maintenance (PM) there are 3 types of BOM namely Functional location Bom , Equipment Bom , Material Bom.

there is field BOM usage while creating BOM based on the requirement the usage key will changes for plant maintenance we will use key number 4 when it comes to production we will use 1 .  

                                                                 

                                                                                  

In each and every Bom one of the item screen will be present and  we can observe that there is item category , material number and quantity. we will maintain each of the fields.
In plant maintenance the below are the things that mostly will be maintained or mostly that are being used 

item category : -

 N -> Non stock item -> if we set the item category as non stock item (N) then a purchase requestion number will be raised from Bom and after the pr will be converted to PO and then Goods receipt in MIGO. Basically this will be done by persons who are responsible for Material Management(MM).

l -> Stock item -> if we set the item category as stock item then it means the stock is present in the inventory and it can be used.

R -> variable size item ->  if we set the item category as variable size item it means the materials size may vary depends upon the situation. Mostly this type of item category will be used by the automobile industries.                                                                                      

Quantity -> enter the number of quantity that is required.
Material number -> the materials which are required will be entered in this field.

Functional location Bom: - 

The functional location Bom refers to structured list of materials that are assigned to functional location. The components or materials which are added in the functional location Bom are required to maintain or to perform tasks for all the equipment's that are installed in the functional location.

Whenever a maintenance order or a work order is being created for the functional location for which Bom is created then these are the materials that are necessary for carrying out the maintenance activities.

To create a functional location Bom we can follow the path 

Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> functional location Bom -> create

entry.title: What's New SAP Asset Performance Management 2507
entry.content:
The 2507 release brings a set of thoughtful enhancements designed to improve your user experience and efficiency.

At the center of this release is our new View Rule Logs app, giving you immediate insight into rule execution and helping you take the right actions faster.

Let's take a closer look.

Introducing Our New App - 'View Rule Logs'

Understanding how your business rules perform is key to ensuring reliable automation. Our new app View Rule Logs, gives you real-time visibility into the execution of business rules—whether they ran successfully or encountered issues. With this insight, you can:

  • Verify execution outcomes, such as whether alerts were triggered, notifications were sent, or external events were created as expected.

  • View and take recommended follow-up actions

  • Quickly diagnose logic or data issues by pinpointing where rules failed due to missing inputs or configuration errors, so you don't have to work it out yourself.

Watch this short video to see it in action.

Video: View Rule Logs application

For more information, see the SAP Help Portal View Rule Logs.

 

Enhanced Filtering by Characteristic Value

The Characteristic Value value help popup in the Select Technical Object window has been enhanced in 2507 to improve usability and search efficiency.

Previously, users had to filter assets by first selecting a class and characteristic - even if they already knew the characteristic value. This was time-consuming and led to usability complaints.

With the new enhancements, users benefit from:

  • A Characteristic Value filter to refine results directly based on known values.
  • A free text search bar that quickly filters across class, characteristic and characteristic value fields.

Now, if a user knows the characteristic value (e.g. Voltage = 220V), they can enter it directly to filter assets. That means there's no need to navigate through class and characteristic first. The older method remains available for users who prefer it.

These improvements enable faster and more precise selection of technical objects, especially useful during assessments, recommendations, or rule processing.

Filter by characteristic value

Spot Critical Alerts Faster with Deduplication Count in List View

High-frequency alerts can indicate critical issues, but until now, spotting them at a glance wasn’t easy. Our latest enhancement to the Manage Alerts screen solves this by introducing a visible Deduplication Count directly in the list view.

This new column helps you immediately recognize which alert types are repeatedly triggering, without needing to open each alert detail page. 

The Deduplication Count is now available under column settings and is enabled by default. When deduplication is active, the count begins at zero and increases as duplicate alerts are grouped. This helps you prioritize action based on real-time alert frequency.

For added usability, a new Last Updated On column has also been positioned between Occurred On and Deduplication Count, making it easier to filter and track the most recent changes.

This small but powerful improvement brings greater clarity and responsiveness to alert management.

Stay Informed and Get Involved

    • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
    • Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.

See you soon for the 2508 update!

entry.title: Breakdown Maintenance End to End Process
entry.content:
BREAKDOWN MAINTENANCE: -

                           In SAP S/4 HANA EAM the breakdown maintenance business process is a type of maintenance activity that will take place or be carried out in response to unexpected failure or breakdowns of equipment. In SAP S/4 HANA EAM breakdown maintenance will be carried out through the creation and execution of maintenance orders and maintenance notifications. In breakdown maintenance you correct a malfunction of equipment by raising the notification in the system. And then the work order will be performed by technician at the equipment and respective authorized person will approve the work order.

                              But the response to the breakdown maintenance should be very rapid because production will stop and due to this the manufacturing of finished material will be stopped and it will be a huge loss for any company.

Work process of breakdown maintenance: -

  1. Identification of breakdown: - here the notification will be created.
  2. Evaluation & Planning: - here evaluation of equipment, review the notification, based on the review they will assign priority, work order creation and also assign the work center or technician for the order.
  3. Execution of breakdown maintenance: -here execution of work order takes place, and the materials or spare parts will be procured from the inventory, equipment will be isolated, and it will be shutdown.
  4.  Documentation and data capture: - here the documentation and confirmation of work order takes place.
  5. Inspection and testing: - inspection and trail of equipment will be done after maintenance.
  6. Completion and reporting: - TECO – technical completion will be takes place in this step.
  7. Continuous improvement: - analysis of data will take place and the company will come up with improvements that need to be made.

STEP 1: -   CREATTION OF NOTIFICATION

We will create a notification through IW21 but here the notification type will be M2. Here M2 is being used because since it is malfunction of an equipment.

Here we will just enter the details of the functional location and equipment in the notification. We will provide the details to tell the technician that in particular location a equipment is present, and it needs to be repaired.
Functional location --> represents the location and equipment --> represents the machine

Here the details of the functional location and equipment will be provided and then after the technician will save the notification. If the equipment already has already existing notifications or else orders, then the object information key will display it in the format as shown below if it is being activated in the configuration path.

The production supervisor will inspect the equipment and then he will add the object parts that need to be inspected, and the damaged parts will be entered in the notification by navigating to the change mode of the notification.

   STEP2: - ADDING OF TASKS TO THE NOTIFICATION

Here after adding the tasks, we can be able to see the items and tasks in the next tabs of the notification. The tasks are being added because it indicated parts that might be damaged.

After entering all the details of object parts and damage in the notification the notification will be released or put in process by clicking on the green flag symbol which is present in the notification

Also, the production supervisor will put in the tasks that are needed to be performed by the technician who is coming for maintenance purposes that he has to perform the maintenance activates that what he needs to perform on the machine.

Here the tasks will also be released from the notification.

STEP 3: -   CREATION OF ORDER BASED ON NOTIFICATION
Here the production supervisor will create a maintenance order through IW34 based on notification and the details will be picked up from the notification itself. And also, here since it is breakdown so the indicator will be checked.

The estimated costs will be given by the maintenance team based upon the requirement of the material and the person resources. 
Here the operational hours to do the maintenance will be added to the operations and the no.of people or manpower that is being required to perform the maintenance is being calculated here. The work center will be given here and the activity type will be picked up from the work center. For the activity type the cost calculation is done in the transaction code KP26 which will be done by FICO team.

In components tab what are the materials that are needed to perform the maintenance are being entered. Here in item category L - Stock item is maintained since there is stock in the inventory. 

After entering the components and the operational hours we will directly put them in the process because it is breakdown. Since we are putting it in a direct process a printout will be taken and then right after the work starts.

STEP 3: - MIGO - Goods Issue Against Order. (Material Management people are responsible for this step)
Here the goods will be issued by the material management by using the t-code MIGO.
A prerequisite that the order needs to be released or else posting goods against the order cannot be done. 
Here just check the movement type whether it is 261- goods issue against the order or not.

STEP 4: -    CONFIRMATION OF ORDER
Here the goods will be posted towards the technician against the order and the technician will perform the maintenance order and then the confirmation will be done and here we will just check the checkboxes like final confirmations, clear reservations, no remaining work.
Final confirmation --> it means the technician have performed his work and no more confirmation can be done for that                                                         operation.
Clear Reservations --> it means if there is any reservation that is done against the order for material it will be cleared.
No remaining work --> the technician has completely done his work, and no more work is pending if the work is still pending then the checkbox will not be checked, and the field remaining work will be entered. 

STEP 5: -    TECO --> TECHNICAL CONFIRMATION
Here after performing the confirmation, the technical confirmation will be done in the order header level as well as in the notification level too by clicking on the confirmation of tasks in the tasks tab in the notification. For order by clicking on the race flag which is present in the order.

After performing TECO for the notification then we will perform TECO for order.

STEP 6: -   SETTLEMENT OF ORDER
After completion of the order the FICO team will do the settlement against the order in KO88.

Accounting document: - Below is the accounting documents for the order.

Controlling document: - Below is the controlling documents against the order.

After performing the settlement by fico team, we will just navigate tot the t-code IW32 which is change mode of the order and here we will just click on the complete business.


Here you can observe the status as close in the system status.

entry.title: Issue Of Non-stock Item To The Work Order
entry.content:
ISSUING NON-STOCK MATERIAL TO WORK ORDER: -

There is a scenario where the material is not present in the inventory, and it needs to be procured from the external vendor then we will just follow the following steps: -

Work process of issuing non-stock items to work order: -

  1. Work order: - A work order is being created and the necessary details like c
  2. omponents and operations are being entered.
  3. Components tab: - here in the components tab the material description will be entered as the material that needs to be procured from the vendor. And also, the item category here will be entered as ‘N’ – non-stock item.
  4. Purchasing data: - the purchasing data must be entered as we have mentioned non-stock items. The purchasing data like purchasing organization, purchasing group, vendor etc.... some of the necessary details will be entered into in the purchasing data.
  5. Converting the purchase requestion into purchase order: - Purchase requestion (PR) will be raised from the order and the Material Management (MM) team will convert the purchase requestion into purchase order (PO).
  6. Converting the purchase order into goods receipt: - After converting into the purchase order, the goods receipt will be done.
  7. No goods issue needed: - Here the goods issue is not needed. When the goods receipt is being done the materials will directly send to the order not into inventory and here you cannot see the stock in the inventory.
  8. Confirmation & TECO: - Confirmation will be done after doing the maintenance activities and then the TECO.
  9. Settlement: - The settlement is being done by the FICO team at the end of the month.

STEP 1: -

Creation of notification will be done based on the requirement that might be whether malfunction (M2) or else maintenance request (M1). Here for example, we will take the maintenance request (M1) It means a machine needs general maintenance in a plant which is being installed in a functional location .

The functional location & equipment details will be maintained by the person at the machine, and he will save the notification. Then after the production supervisor will get in touch with the person who was responsible of creation of notification

STEP 2: -

The production supervisor will go and inspect the machine which is present at the functional location, and he will set the priority, object parts and all the parameters like the object part, tasks , activity etc....

After entering the details of the object part and priority by the production supervisor the notification will be put in the process by clicking on the green flag which is present in the application toolbar.

If any of the tasks need to be performed as well as the causes, the production supervisor will also add them to the notification, and he will also release the tasks too.

Here we can observe the status of the notification.

STEP 3: -

After that we will just create an order based on notification in the T-code IW34 based on notificaiton creation of order.

Here the work order is being created, and the details of the functional location and all the details of the equipment will be picked up from the notification which wa created earlier step .

Here are the operation details and the calculation key will be given  as well as the no.of persons that are required for maintaining the equipment or machine

then the components are maintained in the components tab where the materials that are needed for maintenance and there is one material which is not present in the invenotry.

All the purchasing data will be maintained by the production supervisor and then after he will save the order.

Purchasing organization: - it is responsible for procuring materials or services etc.…

Supplier: - the person who is responsible for giving the goods and services.

G/L account: - for which g/l account the amount needs to be reflected.

Then after that the order will be released and it will be saved.

STEP 4: -

Here the purchase requisition will be raised by the following path: -

Here you can observe the material procurement category for the stock material it is reservation for an order and when it comes to the non-stock item it will be Preq for order.

Select the material and then after just click on the purchasing tab right above it. Here you can observe the details that you have mentioned.

Here the purchase requestion number will be generated, and this purchase requestion will be updated to the MM team or purchasing team which is present in the inventory.

STEP 5: -

Here the material purchase requestion will be converted into the purchase order by using the t-code ME21N. By using the purchase requestion documents overview we will just click on the purchase requestion and then click on the adopt or else we can just drag and drop the purchase requestion. 

We will just click on check and then after we will just save it.

STEP 6: -

After converting the purchase requestion into a purchase order then goods receipt will be done against the purchase order in the transaction code: - MIGO.It means the goods which are being procured from vendor needs to be updated right so we will just do goods reciept against the purchase order. 

Here the movement type will be 101 – goods receipt against the purchase order and the checkbox needs to be checked. Then after click on the check and post. After clicking on post the materials will not be displayed in the inventory and those materials will directly send to the accounts.

Here the material is being procured and then after the invoice will be done based on PO.

STEP 7: -

The invoice will be raised against the purchase order and the invoice will be done in the transaction code: -MIRO.

Here the details of the purchase order will be picked up automatically. And the checkbox calculates tax needs to be checked, and the tax code needs to be entered in the po reference box and then the item ok checkbox too.

Enter the amount in the basic data tab and this is the amount that needs to be sent to the vendor.

Now after this we will just click on stimulate which is present in the application toolbar.

Now just click on save or post.

Note: - Steps 5, 6, 7 are mostly done by material management (MM) team.

STEP 8: -

Now just go back to your order and here just see the materials issued for the order by using the following path.

Now here the materials are being issued to the order.

STEP 9: -

After the materials are being procured and issued to the order the technician will perform the maintenance on the equipment and after performing the maintenance the confirmation will be done through t-code IW41.

STEP 10: -

After confirmation the technical confirmation will be done by going into the change mode of the order. TECO will clear all the material reservations that are being done for any other materials.

STEP11:-
Here after performing the technical confirmation the FICO team will perform the settlement for the order in KO88.Generally the settlement will be done at the end of the month.

Accounting document: -

Controlling documents: -

SUMMARY:-

When a non-stock material is required for a work order and is not available in inventory, a notification is created, and a maintenance order is generated in IW34 with the material entered as item category N along with purchasing details. Releasing the order creates a purchase requisition, which the MM team converts to a PO in ME21N. A goods receipt in MIGO (movement type 101) sends the material directly to the order without adding it to inventory. The vendor invoice is processed in MIRO, the maintenance is confirmed in IW41, the order is technically completed in IW32, and finally, the FICO team settles it in KO88.

The above describes the process of procuring the materials from external or vendor. Feel free to provide any comments or suggestions.

Regards ,
Neeraj

In this blog, I will be walking through how we can handle the resource scheduling for maintenance orders that are part of Phase Based Maintenance framework.

My Business Use Case:

My organization is a Calcined Process Industry and follows phase-based maintenance framework for Reactive and Proactive Maintenance activities. Lately, production team reported that the belt conveyor BC01 belt has torn and ripped in raw material handling area, i.e., Coke Pad. So I have created a Reactive Maintenance order for Belt Conveyor(BC01). Also, I do have scheduled Preventive Maintenance orders for Kiln-01, Belt Conveyor(BC02), and Belt Conveyor(BC03).

If you want to gain a deep understanding of Phase-Based maintenance framework, please find the blog links below.

  • Planning, Adding & Approving Lean Services Using Flexible Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. 

The crux of the SAP S4HANA Asset Management "Resource Scheduling" :

Resource scheduling in SAP S4HANA enables efficient planning of maintenance tasks by providing visibility into workload, capacities, and work center utilization aspects. We can use the apps for resource scheduling to check current and forecasted work center utilization, build schedules, and determine required capacities before dispatching the scheduled work.

Key Benefits Include, but are not limited to:

  • Build an optimal schedule through simulation analysis for open maintenance orders before releasing for execution.
  • Group and Schedule maintenance orders by assets.
  • Control Maintenance Workloads by adjusting activities in the schedule.
  • Distribute Work evenly across capacities and collaborating across other schedulers.

we can update the constraints( Must Start Date &Time), Change Performing Work Center, Dispatch or Assign/Unassign people for the Maintenance Order Operations.

For Instance, let us update the constraint for one of the operations.

We can assign and unassign the people.

We can move the operations to next week by dragging and dropping to ensure the utilization is not more than 100%.

Now let us maintain the relationships and dispatch the operations.

We can maintain Offset/Edit Offset/Delete Offset, and create "Relationships" between operations. For Instance, let us add "2 HRs" offset to one of the operations.

We can Edit or Delete Offset or Relationship.

Once we dispatch the operations, the maintenance order phase moves to the "Execution Phase" and sub-phase moves to "Ready For Execution (Order)".

Now let us visualize the "Scheduling Overview by Asset Wise". For Instance, let us select "Belt Conveyor-01".

We can visualize an asset in its hierarchical structure. Also, we can graphically view the maintenance work planned for the asset and all its sub-assets.

 

Collaborating on a Schedule: We can share a schedule that we created or review a schedule that someone shared with us. The activity log helps us track the changes made by co-planners and reviewers of our schedule. We can also post and reply to the comments in the log.

As the maintenance orders and operations have been dispatched, let us use app. "Manage Schedule" to visualize the work center utilization and share the schedule.

First visualize the work center utilization by "Processing Status".

Now let us share with one of our peers.

 

Now, "Chandana Chelikam" reviews our schedule and provides her feedback on the schedule completeness by accessing the "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now, let us view her feedback (activity log) and reply to her using  "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now let us "Freeze" the schedule by choosing "Freeze Schedule" option.

Now the schedule "2025_CAL_MAINT_WEEK_33"  status becomes " FROZEN".

 

Once the schedule is "Frozen", we can no longer change the schedule. If any new operations are added and dispatched to be completed within the schedule after the schedule was frozen, then the status of those operations under "Completion In Schedule" will shown as "Dispatched In Addition".

 

Now let us track the "Execution Of a Schedule".

Once the schedule period starts, the schedule status changes to "Execution". We can start tracking schedule attainment and the completion of the order operations in our schedule. The prerequisite is that the schedule must be "Frozen" before the schedule period starts.

We can track it either using "Manage Schedule app." or "My Schedules" card in the "Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planners app".

Once we complete the maintenance operations at shop floor, let us confirm the operations using "Perform Maintenance Jobs" app.

For Instance, let us use the option "Quick Confirm".

 

Schedule Attainment: Let us use the "Manage Schedule" app. to view the schedule attainment ratio.

Post maintenance order operations confirmations, The micro chart for the  "Attainment" shows the ratio of the work that was planned for the schedule period  and the work that was completed as planned in the schedule period.

let us visualize the operations completed in schedule between 18.08.2025 to 24.08.2025.

This brings me to the end of my process walk through. 😊 I hope my blog proves useful to the Maintenance Team. I look forward to seeing Maintenance Team using "Resource Scheduling"  functionality to optimize maintenance operations and enhance asset reliability.

entry.title: Plant Maintenance Integration with FICO,MM,PP, QM,HCM,EHS and other modules
entry.content:
Plant maintenance integrates with many of the modules and below are the some of the modules that plant maintenance integrates with: 

FICO(Finance and controlling) :- 

Below are the integration points of plant maintenance with FICO.
Company Code: - A plant will always be assigned to the company code. 
Cost center: - Cost Center is an organizational unit within a controlling area that is used to collect and record costs incurred from business activities.
Investment order: -  investment order needs cost budgeting for an order will be done.
Allocation Structure: -  In the allocation structure the cost elements will be taken from the CO in which these cost elements will gets reflected is any maintenance order have consumption of materials, Labour cost, 3rd party material procurement etc... which will flow the costs to the FI. 
Asset master creation: - When an equipment is being created then the asset will be created with a configuration.
Settlement Of an Order: - The settlement of an order is actually being done for an order because at the cost needs to be settled.
Settlement Profile: - The settlement profile will be assigned to the order type.
Activity Type: - In activity type the price or the cost for labour per hour will be determined by FICO consultant and we need to maintain the activity type in the work center.

PP(Production Planning) :- 
Work Center: - In work center the capacity will be determined by the production planning team. Here the capacity refers to the availability of people and resources for maintenance work.
Equipment Master Data: - In equipment master data there is a field work center in the Location in which we need to give the production planning work center and whereas in the organization. 
Spare Part Preparation: - For example the spare part cannot be procured externally then the spare part will be produced by the production order and the settlement rule of order will be done to the maintenance order.
Refurbishment of Material:- Refurbishment of material will be done if any material in production needs to be repaired as soon as possible then we will just refurbish the material and replace the material within the machine as it was there before the breakdown.

MM(Material Management):-
Components:- The components that are required for maintenance of machine will be taken from the inventory.
Service Entry Sheet:- To procure the service from external that is the maintenance has to be done for a machine and there is no team that is present in the plant(internal team) then we will just raise purchase requestion from the maintenance order and after it the material management people will procure the service through ML81N."
Split valuation:- Split valuation for a material has to be configured so that we can perform the refurbishment order.
Details of plant:- The details of plant related namely Purchase Organization, Vendor, Supplier, Outline agreement number etc..
Serial Number Profile:- A serial number profile must be configured for the material to enable the creation of equipment for that material.
Goods Issue:- Goods issue needs to be done for the order otherwise the technician cannot perform the maintenance activities that are present in the order.
Goods Receipt:- Goods receipt has to be done for the Internal Refurbishment Order and the settlement will be done for the material.
Material Reservation:- after creating the maintenance order the materials will be reserved in the inventory automatically.
Procurement:- Procuring of non-stock material, service entry sheet through purchase requestion.

Quality Management:- 
CatLog Profile:- Catlog profile will be configured by the quality management team and it will be assigned for the equipment , functional location.
Calibration Order:- In calibration order inspection will be done and thereby the equipment can be used or not will be determined by the quality management team.

SD(Sales And Distribution):- 
The place where the sales and distribution as well as plant maintenance will gets integrated is in customer service module.

EHS(Environment Health & Safety):-
The integration part of PM with EHS comes only at the product safety, Work permit - while performing any maintenance at the dangerous or hazardous material or equipment's.

FREM(Flexible Real Estate Management):- 
Flexible real estate management and plant maintenance both comes under Enterprise Asset Management in SAP S/4 Hana.
Real Estate Object: - Real estate object will be considered as functional location/equipment.
Work order:- Notification and work order management à maintenance requests originating from RE-FX can be turned into PM notifications/ orders but this will be done with the help of CRM.
Service Provider Coordination: - PM order can trigger external services with the help of MM (material management) to work on RE-FX managed asset.

HCM(Human Capital Management):-
Person Responsible:- Here the person can be assigned to the work order , work center, Technical Object, Operations in work order too.

DMS(Document Management System):-
Documents can be uploaded for the technical objects, notifications , work orders etc... for information or to follow the rules to keep the equipment runs smoothly.

The above are some of the modules for which the plant maintenance will integrate with.

Hope its informative and feel free to comment for any improvements or suggestions.

Regards,
Neeraj.

entry.title: A Comprehensive User Guide and Test Plan for SAP S/4HANA: Integrated Asset and Lease Management
entry.content:
A Comprehensive User Guide and Test Plan for SAP S/4HANA: Integrated Asset and Lease Management

Introduction

Welcome to this comprehensive guide for SAP S/4HANA. This document is designed for a wide range of users, from business end-users and key users new to the system, to experienced consultants seeking a structured overview of modern asset and lease management processes. We will transform complex procedures into a clear, end-to-end business process flow, making SAP's powerful functionalities accessible to everyone.

Purpose of This Guide

The primary goal of this guide is twofold:

  1. To Educate: To provide a clear, conceptual understanding of the entire lifecycle of assets within an organization—from their initial procurement or lease to their eventual retirement. We will demystify core concepts and explain the "why" behind each process step.
  2. To Enable: To offer practical, step-by-step instructions on how to execute these processes in a modern SAP S/4HANA environment. This includes detailed walkthroughs of master data creation, transactional processing, and period-end activities.

Who Should Use This Guide?

  • End Users: Individuals who will perform daily tasks like creating purchase requisitions for assets or managing contract data. This guide provides clear "how-to" instructions for your role.
  • Key Users: Business process owners who need a deeper understanding of the end-to-end flow to support their teams and drive process improvements.
  • Consultants: Functional and technical consultants can use this guide as a reference for standard business processes (SAP Best Practices), configuration touchpoints, and as a foundation for designing test plans and training materials.
  • Beginners ("Dummies"): If you're new to SAP, this guide breaks down the processes into logical, easy-to-understand steps with real-world examples.

Key Business Processes Covered

We will navigate through three critical, interconnected business areas:

  • Procure-to-Pay for Fixed Assets (P2A): The complete process of identifying a need for an asset, purchasing it, receiving it, paying for it, and seeing it capitalized on the company's books.
  • Asset Lifecycle Management: The management of an asset throughout its useful life, including depreciation, value adjustments, transfers, and eventual retirement from service.
  • Lease-In Contract Management: The modern approach to leasing assets (like buildings or vehicles) according to international accounting standards (IFRS 16 and US GAAP), which involves recognizing Right-of-Use (RoU) assets and Lease Liabilities.

The SAP Fiori Experience

Throughout this guide, we will focus on the SAP Fiori launchpad, SAP's modern, role-based user experience. Fiori provides a simple, intuitive interface with apps tailored to specific tasks. For certain advanced or configuration-related activities, we may also refer to the classic SAP GUI, but the primary focus remains on the modern Fiori apps.

Part 1: The Comprehensive Guide

Chapter 1: Foundational Concepts & Master Data

Before we can transact in SAP, we must first establish the foundational data that defines our organization and the business objects we interact with. This master data is created once and used across many transactions, ensuring consistency and accuracy.

1.1. Organizational Structure: The Backbone of Your Company in SAP

The organizational structure in SAP is a digital representation of your enterprise. The data we will use in our examples is based on a standard model company.

  • Company Code (e.g., 1010): The most important organizational unit. It represents a legal entity for which a complete set of financial statements (Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss statement) is created. All our asset and lease transactions will be posted within a company code.
  • Plant (e.g., 1010): An operational unit within a company, such as a factory, a warehouse, or a regional office. In our asset procurement scenario, the asset will be delivered to a plant.
  • Purchasing Organization (e.g., 1010): The unit responsible for procuring materials and services. It negotiates pricing and conditions with vendors.
  • Chart of Depreciation (e.g., 1010): A corporate-level structure that manages the valuation of assets for different accounting principles. A company code is assigned to one chart of depreciation. It contains various Depreciation Areas.

1.2. Core Master Data for Integrated Processes

1.2.1. Business Partner (Vendor)

In S/4HANA, both customers and vendors are managed centrally as Business Partners (BP). A single BP master record can have different roles assigned to it. For our processes, we need a Business Partner with a Supplier (FI) role to act as the vendor from whom we purchase or lease an asset.

How-To: Create a Vendor Business Partner

  1. Log in to the SAP Fiori launchpad with the Accounts Payable Accountant role.
  2. Open the Manage Business Partner Master Data app.
  3. Choose Create > Organization.
  4. In the Create Organization screen, fill in the essential details:
    • BP Role: Start with 000000 (General).
    • Name: Global Office Supplies Inc.
    • Search Term: GLOBALOFFICE
    • Address: Enter a full address, including street, city, postal code, and country. This is crucial for tax calculations and logistics.
  5. Choose Save. The system will create the BP and assign a number. Note this number.
  6. Now, we extend the BP to the necessary roles. Choose Edit.
  7. In the BP Role dropdown, select Supplier (Financial Accounting) (FLVN00) and choose Create.
  8. A new section for Company Code data will appear. Select it.
  9. Choose Add.
  10. Enter your Company Code (e.g., 1010) and press Enter.
  11. Enter the Reconciliation Account for payables (e.g., the standard domestic payables account).
  12. Go to the Payment Transactions tab and enter the Payment Terms.
  13. Save the changes. The Business Partner is now ready to be used as a vendor in our procurement and leasing processes.

1.2.2. Cost Center

A Cost Center is an organizational unit that incurs costs. When we acquire an asset, we must assign it to a cost center responsible for the costs associated with that asset, such as depreciation.

How-To: Create a Cost Center

  1. Log in to the Fiori launchpad as a General Ledger Accountant.
  2. Open the Manage Cost Centers app.
  3. Choose Create.
  4. Enter the following information:
    • Controlling Area: This is typically linked to your company code (e.g., A000).
    • Cost Center: 10101301 (Example: IT Department)
    • Validity Period: Enter a start and end date (e.g., from today to the end of time 31.12.9999).
  5. Press Enter.
  6. In the Basic Data tab:
    • Name: IT Department
    • Description: Information Technology Department
    • Person Responsible: Enter the name of the department manager.
    • Cost Center Category: Select an appropriate category, like H (Service cost center).
    • Hierarchy Area: Assign it to a node in the standard cost center hierarchy.
    • Company Code: 1010
  7. Choose Save. The cost center is now active and can be assigned to assets.

1.2.3. Asset Master Data

The asset master record is the central repository for all information about a fixed asset. It is structured to support different valuation requirements simultaneously.

Key Concepts:

  • Asset Class: The primary classification for an asset (e.g., Buildings, Vehicles, Computers). The asset class serves as a template, providing default values for depreciation terms and defining which G/L accounts are posted to when transactions occur.
  • Depreciation Areas: These represent different valuation methods for a single asset. A company typically needs multiple depreciation areas to comply with different accounting standards. For example:
    • Area 01: Book Depreciation (Local GAAP)
    • Area 32: Depreciation according to IFRS
    • Area 33: Depreciation according to US GAAP
  • Useful Life: The estimated period over which an asset will be used. This is a key factor in calculating depreciation.

How-To: Create an Asset Master Record

This process is typically performed as part of the asset acquisition process itself, but it can also be done standalone.

  1. Log in to the Fiori launchpad as an Asset Accountant.
  2. Open the Create Asset Fiori app.
  3. In the initial dialog, enter:
    • Asset Class: 3000 (Example: Machinery and Equipment)
    • Company Code: 1010
    • Number of similar assets: 1
  4. Choose Master Data.
  5. On the General tab:
    • Description: Executive Conference Room Projector
    • Capitalized on: This date will be filled automatically upon the first acquisition posting.
  6. Go to the Time-Dependent tab:
    • Choose Add Interval.
    • Enter the Cost Center you created earlier (e.g., 10101301).
  7. Go to the Valuation tab:
    • The system will propose depreciation terms based on the asset class. Review the Depreciation Key (e.g., LIN.) and the Useful Life (e.g., 5 years) for each depreciation area. You can modify these if needed.
  8. Choose Save. The system creates the asset and displays the new asset number. Make a note of this number as it will be used in the procurement process.

Chapter 2: The Asset Lifecycle - From Procurement to Retirement (Scope Item J62)

This chapter details the journey of a tangible fixed asset, starting from its purchase through its operational use and concluding with its removal from the company's books.

2.1. Acquiring an Asset via Procurement (The "P2A" Process)

The most common way to acquire a new asset is through the standard procurement process. This ensures proper approvals, tracking, and financial integration. This process integrates Materials Management (MM) with Asset Accounting (FI-AA).

Conceptual Overview:

When you purchase a standard inventory item, the value goes into an inventory account. When you purchase a fixed asset, the value must be "capitalized"—meaning it's recorded on the balance sheet as an asset, not expensed immediately. The key to this process is the Account Assignment Category 'A' (for Asset), which tells the system to post the value to a specific asset master record instead of an expense or inventory account.

Practical Exercise: Purchasing a New Projector

Step 1: Create a Purchase Requisition (The Need)

A manager in the IT department identifies the need for a new high-end projector for the main conference room. They create a purchase requisition to formally request this purchase.

  1. Log in as a Purchaser.
  2. Open the Fiori app Create Purchase Requisition - Advanced (Transaction ME51N).
  3. In the Item Overview section, enter the following details:
    • A (Account Assignment Cat.): A (Asset). This is the crucial step!
    • Short Text: New 4K Conference Room Projector
    • Quantity: 1
    • Unit of Measure: PC (Piece)
    • Matl Group: YBFA08 (Office Equipment)
    • Plant: 1010
    • Valuation Price: 3000 (The estimated price in EUR)
  4. Press Enter. The system will open the Item Detail section below.
  5. Go to the Account Assignment tab in the item details.
  6. Enter the Asset number you created in Chapter 1.
  7. Choose Check at the top of the screen. The system should show a message "No messages issued during check."
  8. Choose Save. The system will create the Purchase Requisition and provide a number. Note it down.

Step 2: Convert Requisition to Purchase Order (The Order)

The purchasing department reviews the requisition and converts it into a formal Purchase Order to send to the vendor.

  1. Log in as a Purchaser.
  2. Open the Fiori app Process Purchase Requisitions (F1048).
  3. Search for your purchase requisition number.
  4. Select the line item for your requisition and choose Create Purchase Order.
  5. The system will carry over most of the data. You must enter the Vendor (the Business Partner you created, e.g., 10300001).
  6. Verify the price and other details. The Account Assignment 'A' and the asset number will be carried over automatically.
  7. Save the Purchase Order. The system will generate a PO number. Note it down.

Step 3: Post Goods Receipt (The Delivery)

The vendor delivers the projector. The warehouse clerk receives the item and records its arrival in the system.

  1. Log in as a Warehouse Clerk.
  2. Open the Fiori app Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document (F0843).
  3. Enter the Purchase Order number from the previous step and press Enter.
  4. The system displays the details from the PO.
  5. Select the Item OK checkbox to confirm the receipt.
  6. Choose Post. The system confirms the goods receipt with a Material Document number.
    • Financial Impact: Because this is a non-valuated goods receipt for an asset, there is typically no financial posting at this stage. The asset is not capitalized yet. The value is "in transit" on a technical clearing account.

Step 4: Post Supplier Invoice (The Capitalization)

The vendor sends the invoice for the projector. The Accounts Payable accountant receives it and posts it against the purchase order, which triggers the capitalization of the asset.

  1. Log in as an Accounts Payable Accountant.
  2. Open the Fiori app Create Supplier Invoice - Advanced (Transaction MIRO).
  3. Enter the following header data:
    • Invoice Date: Today's date
    • Reference: The vendor's invoice number (e.g., INV-PJ-5567)
    • Amount: 3000 (The total amount from the invoice)
  4. In the PO Reference section, enter your Purchase Order number and press Enter.
  5. The system will pull in the line item details from the PO and the goods receipt. The amount should match.
  6. The balance at the top right should be green (zero).
  7. Choose Simulate to see the resulting accounting entry before posting. You will see a debit to the asset's reconciliation account and a credit to the vendor's account.
  8. Choose Post. The system posts the invoice and the asset is now officially capitalized.

Verification: Use the Manage Fixed Assets app to display your asset. You will now see the acquisition value of €3,000 on the capitalization date (the invoice posting date).

2.2. Managing the Asset During Its Life

Depreciation

Depreciation is the systematic allocation of an asset's cost over its useful life. It represents the "using up" of the asset's value. SAP S/4HANA automates this process.

  1. Concept: Based on the depreciation key (LIN. for straight-line) and useful life (5 years) in the asset master, the system calculates the annual depreciation (€3,000 / 5 years = €600) and breaks it down into monthly amounts (€50).
  2. Execution: The depreciation is not posted one by one, but as a periodic batch job for all assets.
    • Log in as an Asset Accountant.
    • Open the app Schedule Asset Accounting Jobs (F1914).
    • Choose Create.
    • Select the Job Template Depreciation Posting Run.
    • Give the job a name, like Depr_Run_1010_Period_XX.
    • Choose Step 2 and schedule it to run immediately.
    • In Step 3, enter the parameters:
      • Company Code: 1010
      • Fiscal Year: Current Year
      • Posting Period: The period you want to post.
      • Test Run: It's a best practice to first run it as a Test Run. The log will show any errors or the planned postings without actually creating documents.
      • Actual Run: Once the test run is successful, schedule the job again with the Test Run checkbox deselected.
  3. Financial Impact: The system posts a journal entry:
    • Debit: Depreciation Expense Account
    • Credit: Accumulated Depreciation Account (a contra-asset account that reduces the net book value of the asset).

2.3. Asset Retirement

After 5 years, the projector is obsolete and is sold for €100.

  1. Log in as an Asset Accountant.
  2. Open the Fiori app Post Asset Retirement (F7107).
  3. Choose Other Posting Transaction > Post Retirement > Retirement with Revenue.
  4. Enter the General Information:
    • Company Code: 1010
    • Main Asset Number: Your projector's asset number.
    • Journal Entry, Posting, and Asset Value Date: Today's date.
  5. In the Posting Information section:
    • Revenue Amount: 100
    • Retirement Type: Complete Retirement
  6. Choose Simulate to review the posting. The system will automatically calculate the Net Book Value (NBV), compare it to the revenue, and calculate the gain or loss on the sale.
  7. Choose Post. The asset is now retired, and the gain/loss is posted to the P&L.

Chapter 3: Lease Accounting - Right-of-Use Assets (Scope Items 5YU & 63Q)

Modern accounting standards like IFRS 16 and ASC 842 (US GAAP) have fundamentally changed how companies account for leases. Gone are the days of simple operating leases that were just an expense on the P&L. Now, most leases must be brought onto the balance sheet.

3.1. Introduction to Modern Lease Accounting

The Core Concept:

When you sign a long-term lease (e.g., for a building), you have acquired the right to use that asset for the lease term. This "right" is itself an asset. Simultaneously, you have created an obligation to make future lease payments, which is a liability.

  • Right-of-Use (RoU) Asset: An intangible asset representing your right to use the leased item. It is capitalized and depreciated over the lease term.
  • Lease Liability: A financial liability representing the present value of all future lease payments you are obligated to make.

SAP's Contract and Lease Management module automates the complex calculations and postings required for this process. The main difference between IFRS (5YU) and US GAAP (63Q) lies in how leases are classified and how the expense is recognized, but the initial creation of the RoU asset and liability is similar.

3.2. Setting the Stage: Real Estate Objects & Contracts

Before we can have a lease, we need something to lease. We'll lease an office floor for our company.

Prerequisite: A Real Estate object must exist. This is typically managed by a Real Estate Specialist. For this guide, we assume a building BUILDING-01 with a floor FLOOR-02 has been created.

Step 1: Enable a Real Estate Object for Use

We need to make FLOOR-02 available for our company code 1010 to use and assign costs to.

  1. Log in as a Real Estate Specialist - Location Management.
  2. Open the app Group Real Estate Object for Use (F5397).
  3. Search for your BUILDING-01.
  4. Select FLOOR-02 from the structure and choose Create Group.
  5. In the dialog box, enter:
    • Usage Enablement Type: Lease-in
    • Controlling Object Type: Leading Object for Controlling
    • Leading Cost Object ID: Select a cost center that will bear the costs for this floor (e.g., 10101101 - Administration).
  6. Choose Create Group. The floor is now enabled for use.

Step 2: Create the Lease-In Contract

Now, we create the legal contract in the system that governs this lease.

  1. Log in as a Contract Specialist - Leasing.
  2. Open the app Manage Contract (Transaction RECN).
  3. Choose Create Object.
  4. Enter Contract Type Lease In Real Estate and Company Code 1010. Choose Continue.
  5. On the General Data tab:
    • Contract Name: 5-Year Lease for Rouen Office Floor 2
    • Valuation relevance: Leasing Valuation (This is critical to trigger the RoU process).
  6. Go to the Partners tab:
    • Choose Assign New Partner. Select the role Supplier(Fin.Accounting).
    • Search for and assign your landlord's Business Partner number (e.g., 10300001).
  7. Go to the Term tab:
    • Contract start date: The first day of next month.
    • 1st Contract End: 5 years from the start date.
  8. Go to the Objects tab:
    • Choose Assign. Select Real Estate Object and find the usage group for FLOOR-02 that you created.
  9. Go to the Conditions tab:
    • This is where you define the payments. Choose Insert Condition(s).
    • Select a condition type for basic rent.
    • Enter the payment details:
      • Unit Price: 5000
      • Currency: EUR
      • Under Terms, check the payment frequency (e.g., Monthly in Advance).
  10. Choose Save. The system saves the contract in a Created status.
  11. Review all data, then choose Activate. The contract is now legally and systemically active.

3.3. The Heart of the Process: Contract Valuation

With an active contract, the system can now perform the valuation to generate the RoU Asset and Lease Liability. This is often triggered automatically upon activation but can also be run manually.

  1. Log in as a Contract Valuation Specialist - Leasing.
  2. Open the Manage Contract (RECN) app again and go to your contract.
  3. Go to the Valuation Parameters tab.
  4. Here you will assign a Valuation Rule. The system might propose one based on your configuration. For our example, we select a rule relevant for IFRS 16.
  5. The rule requires an Interest Rate. This is the incremental borrowing rate. Enter a rate, for example, 3.5%.
  6. Once the rule is complete, choose Save.
  7. To see the result, open the Display Contract Valuation (RECESH) app.
  8. Enter your contract number and execute. The system will display the cash flow, the calculated Present Value (which is the initial value of your Lease Liability and RoU Asset), and the planned postings for interest, payments, and depreciation.

Financial Impact (Initial Recognition): The valuation triggers a posting:

  • Debit: Right-of-Use Asset (Balance Sheet)
  • Credit: Lease Liability (Balance Sheet)

An asset master record is automatically created in the background for this new RoU asset, linking it directly to the processes in Asset Accounting (FI-AA).

3.4. The Ongoing Lease Lifecycle

Step 1: Periodic Posting (Making the Rent Payment)

Each month, the rent payment needs to be posted.

  1. Log in as an Accounts Payable Accountant - Leasing.
  2. Open the Periodic Posting: Contracts (RERAPP) app.
  3. Enter the selection criteria:
    • Company Code: 1010
    • Contract: Your contract number
    • Month for Posting Run: The month of the first payment.
    • Posting Run Mode: First, run a Simulation.
  4. Execute. The system shows the planned posting. It will be a debit to the vendor and a credit to a bank clearing account.
  5. Once verified, run it again in Update Run mode to create the actual financial document.

Step 2: Post Contract Valuation (Interest & Liability Reduction)

Along with the payment, the monthly valuation posting must occur. This recognizes the interest expense and reduces the lease liability.

  1. Log in as a Contract Valuation Specialist - Leasing.
  2. Open the Post Valuation for Contracts (RECEEP) app.
  3. Enter similar selection criteria as the periodic posting (contract, month, etc.).
  4. Run a Simulation first, then an Update Run.
  5. Financial Impact: The system posts a journal entry:
    • Debit: Interest Expense (P&L)
    • Debit: Lease Liability (Balance Sheet - reduction of the liability)
    • Credit: Clearing Account

Step 3: RoU Asset Depreciation

The RoU asset is depreciated just like the projector we purchased. This happens during the standard asset depreciation run explained in Chapter 2. The system automatically includes the new RoU asset in this run.

Chapter 4: Customizing and Configuration Highlights

This chapter provides a high-level overview of the key configuration settings that drive the processes described above. These activities are performed by consultants during system implementation using either SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC) for Cloud or the Implementation Guide (SPRO) for On-Premise.

4.1. Asset Accounting (FI-AA)

  • Path: Manage Your Solution > Configure Your Solution > Finance > Asset Accounting
  • Key Activities:
    • Assign Chart of Depreciation to Company Code: The fundamental link between the company code and asset accounting rules.
    • Define Asset Classes: This is where you configure the different types of assets. For each class, you set default values, screen layouts, and most importantly, the Account Determination. Account Determination links the asset class to the specific G/L accounts used for APC, accumulated depreciation, depreciation expense, gain/loss, etc.
    • Define Depreciation Keys: This is where the calculation methods for depreciation are defined (e.g., straight-line, declining-balance, multi-level methods).
    • Make Company Code Settings - Asset Accounting-Specific: Used to set the status of a company code (e.g., for testing, productive), define legacy data transfer parameters, and perform the year-end close.

4.2. Contract and Lease Management (RE-FX)

  • Path: Manage Your Solution > Configure Your Solution > Finance > Contract and Lease Management
  • Key Activities:
    • Define Contract Types: Set up different types of contracts (e.g., Lease-In, Lease-Out) and their properties.
    • Define Condition Types: Define the different financial streams in a contract (e.g., Basic Rent, Service Charge, etc.) and their calculation and posting characteristics.
    • Valuation Rule: This is the core of lease accounting configuration. Here you define rules for different accounting principles (IFRS, US GAAP). Within the rule, you specify:
      • Which condition types are relevant for the present value calculation.
      • The G/L accounts for posting the RoU asset and liability.
      • The interest calculation method.
      • The asset class to be used for the automatically created RoU assets.

Part 2: The Comprehensive Test Plan

This section provides structured, end-to-end test scenarios that you can execute in a test or quality system to practice and validate the processes described in this guide.

Introduction to Testing

  • Objective: To ensure that the system is configured correctly and that business processes run smoothly from start to finish, including all integration points.
  • Prerequisites: Before starting, ensure you have the necessary user roles assigned and that the foundational master data (vendors, cost centers, G/L accounts) exists in your test system. The sample data used in the guide (Company Code 1010, etc.) should be available.

Test Scenario 1: End-to-End Procure-to-Retire for a Purchased Asset

A.2. Glossary of Terms

  • APC (Acquisition and Production Costs): The original cost of an asset.
